Welcome

Free Initial Medical Consultation

I am an Internal Medicine MD and have been practicing since 1999. I run a small, family-run general medicine practice in Wicker Park dedicated to providing compassionate, personalized, one-on-one medical care to each and every one of my patients.

I have seen first-hand the immensely positive impact on the quality of life of my patients and am committed to helping others gain access to this important medicine. This is why I have been helping patients access medicine since the program began in 2015 and am firmly committed to helping others.

We look forward to seeing you!

The Process

Our simple four-step process to get a Illinois Medical Card
can be completed in just one visit!

1. Online form

Fill out the form. We'll email you back right away.

2. Appointment

We will send you a link to set up an appointment for your initial consultation.Â  We can usually see patients within a week.

3. Certification

Depending on medical history, many patients receive their signed physician certification after their very first visit.

We charge $300 for patients who receive a medical certification, regardless of how many visits are required before the certification is signed.

If you do not qualify you will not be charged.

4. Application

Our support staff will help you complete your application at no additional charge.

However, you will have to pay either $100 (1-year card) or $250 (3-year card) to the State of Illinois to complete the application.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q.
What other requirements are there to get a card?
A.

You must be able to demonstrate that you are an Illinois resident, with either a driver's license or official mail in your name sent to an Illinois address.

Q.
Do you accept insurance?
A.

No. All expenses are out-of-pocket.

Q.
How old do I have to be?
A.

There is no age minimum. Minors will need parental consent and will also require a second doctor's certification, which will require an additional doctor's visit and cost an additional $100.

Q.
What if I'm not sure that I qualify?
A.

Fill out the form with the information you have and let's figure it out together. Many more people qualify than believe they do and, with a free initial consultation, there's no risk to you in trying.

Q.
How long does it take to get a card?
A.

Before recent changes to the law, it was taking about 3 months after the application was submitted. However, now that background checks have ended we expect this number to drop very quickly.
